title: AttributeError: 'StataSession' object has no attribute 'log_fd'
body:
#### Problem description

I am actually not quite sure what happened. I was able to use Stata kernel with no issues on Wednesday. But today when I started it up I was not able to get the kernel running. I've tried updating it, as well as uninstalling and reinstalling. 

My first initial error was that the stata path was missing. And I fixed that by going into .stata_kernel.conf and adding the path.
stata_path = C:\Program Files\Stata16\StataMP-64.exe

But I am at my wits end with the next issue. 


#### Debugging log

I checked the .stata_kernel_cache folder but its empty. This is what I got from Anaconda Prompt
